title: POS Layout
text: The sub-menus for Button Management and Clerk Roles are organized into logical sections. The following diagram shows the POS divided into essential sections. Familiarizing yourself with these sections will help you choose the correct button to manage. Header Displays notifications, date, time and store / clerk information. Receipt This is where you interact with items for sales and other functions within the POS. The Receipt Item Line This is specifically the Receipt screen when you have added an item to the POS, rather than an Item Group, Expense, Gift Certificate, Account Deposit or Set. Widgets The function of Widgets can be enabled and disabled by your K3 representative, account manager or support staff. Right Menu POS Function This is where you interact with day-to-day functions within the POS that are not directly related to finding items in the database.
description:
The sub-menus for Button Management and Clerk Roles are organized into logical sections. The following diagram shows the POS divided into essential sections. Familiarizing yourself with these sections will help you choose the correct button to manage.


HeaderDisplays notifications, date, time and store / clerk information.
ReceiptThis is where you interact with items for sales and other functions within the POS.
The Receipt Item LineThis is specifically the Receipt screen when you have added an item to the POS, rather than an Item Group, Expense, Gift Certificate, Account Deposit or Set.
WidgetsThe function of Widgets can be enabled and disabled by your K3 representative, account manager or support staff.
Right Menu POS Function
This is where you interact with day-to-day functions within the POS that are not directly related to finding items in the database.

title: Header
text: Below shows the icons which will be displayed on the POS Header and their function. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Header section. POS Offline. Show Widgets. Show Connector Selection. Toggle Full Screen. Show Header Notifications. Show Aside Menu. Header Notifications are accessed by clicking the Show Header Notifications button. To activate these buttons use the Header Notifications section in Button Management.
description:
Below shows the icons which will be displayed on the POS Header and their function. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Header section.



 POS Offline.

  

Show Widgets.


Show Connector Selection.


Toggle Full Screen.


Show Header Notifications.


Show Aside Menu.


Header Notifications are accessed by clicking the Show Header Notifications button. To activate these buttons use the Header Notifications section in Button Management.

title: Receipt
text: Search Item (see Search Item below) NOTE: A similar looking button also appears in Payment and must be independently managed there. NOTE: A similar looking button also appears in Payment and must be independently managed there. Process Payment. Total Amount Total Percent Left Discount Button. Right Discount Button Search Item Within the items listed each will show with two buttons. If a button is disabled in Button Management, then this will apply to all items. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Search Item section. Add to Basket. Print Label. Receipt Item Line To set Button Management for these buttons use the Receipt Item Line section. New Line Price, shows the on-screen keyboard to input a new line price. Delete Line. Add Text. Return Item. Sales Rep. Print Gift Receipt Deliver Required. Exclude Line from Loyalty. NOTE: When the button is green, it indicates that the line is included in loyalty. Conversely, if toggled to red, the line will be excluded from loyalty. Remove Discount. Quantity. Minus Quantity. Add Quantity. Amount Discount. Percentage Discount. Left Discount Button. Right Discount Button. Receipt Item Group When you add an Item Group item to a transaction, it creates an Item Group line on the receipt. The buttons on the Item Group line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they function independently. If you need to manage these buttons, go to the Receipt Item Group section to adjust the Button Management settings. Receipt Gift Certificate Adding a Gift Certificate item to a transaction results in a Gift Certificate line on the receipt. The buttons on the Gift Certificate line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they function independently. For instance, you might want to enable the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but disable it on the Receipt Gift Certificate line. To configure Button Management settings for these buttons, access the Receipt Gift Certificate section. Receipt Account Deposit If you add an Account Deposit item to the transaction, it creates an Account Deposit line on the receipt. The buttons on the Account Deposit line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they function independently. For instance, you may want to enable the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but disable it on the Receipt Account Deposit line. To manage these buttons, navigate to the Receipt Account Deposit section and configure the Button Management settings accordingly. Receipt Sell Set When you add a Sell Set group of items to the transaction this is known as a Sell Set line. The Sell Set line within the Receipt uses a similar set of buttons as per the Receipt Item Line section above but buttons act independently to the Receipt Item Line i.e., you may wish to allow the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but not on the Receipt Sell Set line. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Receipt Sell Set section. Delete Set. This will remove the entire set. Receipt Expense Adding an Expense item to the transaction creates an Expense line on the receipt. The buttons on the Expense line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they operate independently. For instance, you might want to activate the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but disable it on the Receipt Expense line. To configure the Button Management settings for these buttons, access the Receipt Expense section.

Search Item (see Search Item below)



 

NOTE: A similar looking button also appears in Payment and must be independently managed there.

Search Item

Within the items listed each will show with two buttons. If a button is disabled in Button Management, then this will apply to all items. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Search Item section.



 Add to Basket.


 Print Label.


Receipt Item Line

To set Button Management for these buttons use the Receipt Item Line section.




New Line Price, shows the on-screen keyboard to input a new line price.




Delete Line.




Add Text.




Return Item.




Sales Rep.




Print Gift Receipt




Deliver Required. 



Exclude Line from Loyalty. NOTE: When the button is green, it indicates that the line is included in loyalty. Conversely, if toggled to red, the line will be excluded from loyalty.

Receipt Item Group

When you add an Item Group item to a transaction, it creates an Item Group line on the receipt. The buttons on the Item Group line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they function independently. If you need to manage these buttons, go to the Receipt Item Group section to adjust the Button Management settings.


Receipt Gift Certificate

Adding a Gift Certificate item to a transaction results in a Gift Certificate line on the receipt. The buttons on the Gift Certificate line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they function independently. For instance, you might want to enable the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but disable it on the Receipt Gift Certificate line. To configure Button Management settings for these buttons, access the Receipt Gift Certificate section.


Receipt Account Deposit 

If you add an Account Deposit item to the transaction, it creates an Account Deposit line on the receipt. The buttons on the Account Deposit line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they function independently. For instance, you may want to enable the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but disable it on the Receipt Account Deposit line. To manage these buttons, navigate to the Receipt Account Deposit section and configure the Button Management settings accordingly.  


Receipt Sell Set 

When you add a Sell Set group of items to the transaction this is known as a Sell Set line. The Sell Set line within the Receipt uses a similar set of buttons as per the Receipt Item Line section above but buttons act independently to the Receipt Item Line i.e., you may wish to allow the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but not on the Receipt Sell Set line. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Receipt Sell Set section. 



Delete Set. This will remove the entire set.


Receipt Expense

Adding an Expense item to the transaction creates an Expense line on the receipt. The buttons on the Expense line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they operate independently. For instance, you might want to activate the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but disable it on the Receipt Expense line. To configure the Button Management settings for these buttons, access the Receipt Expense section.

title: Right Menu POS Functions
text: To set Button Management for these buttons use the Right Menu POS Functions section. Account Deposit: This button will only show when a customer is selected within the Widgets menu. Cancel Sale: Before disabling the option to Cancel Sale, careful consideration should be given as doing so would prevent the clerk from being able to lock the POS without this button. Item Group After selecting the Item Group button on the Right Menu PoS Functions you will see these buttons. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Group section. This will Cancel any action. This will reset any current actions. This will bring up a search box for you to narrow down options. This will confirm current selections. Please note that in the Right Menu POS Functions set of buttons, several buttons may appear similar but can be individually enabled or disabled. For instance, the Cancel button in Item Shortcuts has the same appearance as the Cancel button in Item Group. However, the buttons are independently controlled in Button Management by enabling or disabling the corresponding option under Item Shortcuts. Item Shortcuts The Item Shortcuts option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Cancel button on Item Group but not on Item Shortcuts. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Shortcuts section. Create Gift Certificate The Create Gift Certificate option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Create Gift Certificate. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Create Gift Certificate section. Sell Set The Sell Set option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Sell Set. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Sell Set section. Make Expense The Make Expense option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Make Expense. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Make Expense section. Parked Transactions The Parked Transactions option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Parked Transactions. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Parked Transactions section. Individual parked transactions listed have the following buttons that can be managed. Delete. Add to Basket. Find Receipt The buttons in the Find Receipt section have names that match those assigned in Button Management. Some buttons may resemble those in the Item Group, but they operate independently. You can enable or disable buttons as needed, such as allowing the Reset button on Item Group but not on Find Receipt. To manage these buttons, go to the Find Receipt section and adjust the Button Management settings. The individual receipts listed have their own buttons that can also be managed. Reprint Last Receipt. Return. Print Gift Copy. Email Receipt Copy. Cancel. Receipt Copy/Filters - This will open a search bar with dates you can search. Search for specific dates of a receipt. Show More Results.
description:
To set Button Management for these buttons use the Right Menu POS Functions section.





















































 


Account Deposit: This button will only show when a customer is selected within the Widgets menu.



Cancel Sale: Before disabling the option to Cancel Sale, careful consideration should be given as doing so would prevent the clerk from being able to lock the POS without this button. 



Item Group

After selecting the Item Group button on the Right Menu PoS Functions you will see these buttons. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Group section.




 This will Cancel any action.




This will reset any current actions.





This will bring up a search box for you to narrow down options.




 

This will confirm current selections.




Please note that in the Right Menu POS Functions set of buttons, several buttons may appear similar but can be individually enabled or disabled. For instance, the Cancel button in Item Shortcuts has the same appearance as the Cancel button in Item Group. However, the buttons are independently controlled in Button Management by enabling or disabling the corresponding option under Item Shortcuts.


Item Shortcuts

The Item Shortcuts option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Cancel button on Item Group but not on Item Shortcuts. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Shortcuts section. 

Create Gift Certificate

The Create Gift Certificate option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Create Gift Certificate. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Create Gift Certificate section. 

Sell Set

The Sell Set option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Sell Set. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Sell Set section. 

Make Expense 

The Make Expense option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Make Expense. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Make Expense section. 

Parked Transactions 

The Parked Transactions option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Parked Transactions. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Parked Transactions section. Individual parked transactions listed have the following buttons that can be managed.



Delete.




Add to Basket.




Find Receipt 

The buttons in the Find Receipt section have names that match those assigned in Button Management. Some buttons may resemble those in the Item Group, but they operate independently. You can enable or disable buttons as needed, such as allowing the Reset button on Item Group but not on Find Receipt. To manage these buttons, go to the Find Receipt section and adjust the Button Management settings. The individual receipts listed have their own buttons that can also be managed.


 

Reprint Last Receipt.






Return.



 


Print Gift Copy.





Email Receipt Copy.





Cancel.




Receipt Copy/Filters - This will open a search bar with dates you can search.





Search for specific dates of a receipt.





Show More Results.

title: Aside Menu
text: The Aside Menu can be opened by clicking on the Show Aside menu button located in the Header. The buttons within the Aside Menu are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Aside Menu section. X Report The buttons in the X Report are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, access the X Report section and use the Button Management feature. Picklist Report The buttons in the Picklist Report are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Picklist Report section and utilize the Button Management functionality. Cash Statement The buttons in the Cash Statement section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, go to the Cash Statement section and access the Button Management feature. Morning Amount The buttons in the Morning Amount section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To adjust the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Morning Amount section and utilize the Button Management functionality. Card Terminal Actions The buttons in the Card Terminal Actions section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, go to the Card Terminal Actions section and use the Button Management feature. The Terminal Actions menu can be accessed from within the Card Terminal Actions. Journals The buttons in the Journals section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, access the Journals section and use the Button Management feature.
description:
The Aside Menu can be opened by clicking on the Show Aside menu button located in the Header. The buttons within the Aside Menu are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Aside Menu section.



X Report 

The buttons in the X Report are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, access the X Report section and use the Button Management feature. 

Picklist Report 

The buttons in the Picklist Report are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Picklist Report section and utilize the Button Management functionality. 

Cash Statement 

The buttons in the Cash Statement section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, go to the Cash Statement section and access the Button Management feature. 

Morning Amount 

The buttons in the Morning Amount section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To adjust the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Morning Amount section and utilize the Button Management functionality. 

Card Terminal Actions 

The buttons in the Card Terminal Actions section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, go to the Card Terminal Actions section and use the Button Management feature. The Terminal Actions menu can be accessed from within the Card Terminal Actions. 

Journals 

The buttons in the Journals section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, access the Journals section and use the Button Management feature.

title: Payment
text: Payment The buttons in the Payment section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To adjust the settings for these buttons, go to the Payment section and utilize the Button Management feature. Please note that both Quick Cash and Quick Card have similar-looking buttons that also appear in the Receipt section. To manage them, you must independently configure their settings in the Receipt section. Right Menu Payment The buttons in the Right Menu Payment section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Right Menu Payment section and utilize the Button Management feature. Please note that the Loyalty Bonus button will only appear when the Loyalty module is in use and a registered customer has enough points to redeem. Similarly, the Account button will only be visible when a customer with a creditworthy account is selected.
description:
Payment 

The buttons in the Payment section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To adjust the settings for these buttons, go to the Payment section and utilize the Button Management feature.

Please note that both Quick Cash and Quick Card have similar-looking buttons that also appear in the Receipt section. To manage them, you must independently configure their settings in the Receipt section.

Right Menu Payment 

The buttons in the Right Menu Payment section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Right Menu Payment section and utilize the Button Management feature.

Please note that the Loyalty Bonus button will only appear when the Loyalty module is in use and a registered customer has enough points to redeem. Similarly, the Account button will only be visible when a customer with a creditworthy account is selected.

title: Terminal Actions
text: The functions here are dependent on your card provider.
description: The functions here are dependent on your card provider.

title: Button Management
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible Button Management, in conjunction with Clerk Roles, allows you to manage the enabled or disabled state of a button for a group of clerks. In the POS Admin section, Button Management enables you to control access to specific POS functions at the shop level. On the other hand, Clerk Roles allow you to control access to POS functions for groups of clerks. Please note that Clerk Roles take precedence over Button Management settings. If a clerk does not have a role set, the button's state will be determined by the settings configured in Button Management. In both Button Management and Clerk Roles, many buttons are labelled with text. In such cases, the button option to enable or disable will correspond to the button label shown on the POS. However, if a button is displayed with an icon only on the POS, this documentation will provide a representation of the button and its location to help you navigate to the correct option. The POS layout consists of different sections, and understanding these key areas will aid you in selecting the appropriate button to manage: 1. Header: This section displays notifications, date, time, and store/clerk information. 2. Receipt: Here, you interact with items for sales and perform other functions within the POS. 3. The Receipt Item Line: This refers specifically to the Receipt screen when you have added an item to the POS, excluding Item Group, Expense, Gift Certificate, Account Deposit, or Set. 4. Widgets: The functionality of Widgets can be enabled or disabled by your K3 representative, account manager, or support staff. 5. Right Menu POS Function: This section allows you to interact with day-to-day functions within the POS that are not directly related to finding items in the database.
description:
The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible


Button Management, in conjunction with Clerk Roles, allows you to manage the enabled or disabled state of a button for a group of clerks.


In the POS Admin section, Button Management enables you to control access to specific POS functions at the shop level. On the other hand, Clerk Roles allow you to control access to POS functions for groups of clerks. Please note that Clerk Roles take precedence over Button Management settings. If a clerk does not have a role set, the button's state will be determined by the settings configured in Button Management.


In both Button Management and Clerk Roles, many buttons are labelled with text. In such cases, the button option to enable or disable will correspond to the button label shown on the POS. However, if a button is displayed with an icon only on the POS, this documentation will provide a representation of the button and its location to help you navigate to the correct option.




The POS layout consists of different sections, and understanding these key areas will aid you in selecting the appropriate button to manage:


1. Header: This section displays notifications, date, time, and store/clerk information.

2. Receipt: Here, you interact with items for sales and perform other functions within the POS.

3. The Receipt Item Line: This refers specifically to the Receipt screen when you have added an item to the POS, excluding Item Group, Expense, Gift Certificate, Account Deposit, or Set.

4. Widgets: The functionality of Widgets can be enabled or disabled by your K3 representative, account manager, or support staff.

5. Right Menu POS Function: This section allows you to interact with day-to-day functions within the POS that are not directly related to finding items in the database.

title: Header
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible. Below shows the icons which will be displayed on the POS Header and their function. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Header section. PoS Offline Show Widgets Show Connector Selection Toggle Fullscreen Show Header Notifications Show Aside Menu Header Notifications are accessed by clicking the Show Header Notifications button. To activate these buttons use the Header Notifications section in Button Management.

title: Right Menu POS Functions
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Right Menu POS Functions section. The Account Deposit button will only show when a customer is selected in the Widgets menu. Cancel Sale disabling this option should be thoroughly considered as the clerk will not be able to lock the POS without this button. Item Group After selecting the Item Group button on the Right Menu PoS Functions you will see these buttons. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Group section. Cancel Reset Filter OK NOTE: Within the Right Menu POS Functions set of buttons several similar-looking buttons can be enabled or disabled independently of each other. For example, Item Shortcuts has a Cancel button that looks identical to the Cancel button in Item Group but is independently controlled in Button Management by enabling or disabling the option under Item Shortcuts. Item Shortcuts The Item Shortcuts option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Cancel button on Item Group but not on Item Shortcuts. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Shortcuts section. Create Gift Certificate The Create Gift Certificate option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Create Gift Certificate. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Create Gift Certificate section. Sell Set The Sell Set option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Sell Set. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Sell Set section. Make Expense The Make Expense option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Make Expense. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Make Expense section. Parked Transactions The Parked Transactions option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Parked Transactions. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Parked Transactions section. Individual parked transactions listed have the following buttons that can be managed. Delete Add to Basket Find Receipt Within Find Receipt the buttons are named to match the titles given in Button Management. Some buttons use a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Find Receipt. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Find Receipt section. Individual receipts listed have the following buttons that can be managed. Reprint the Last Receipt. Return. Print Gift Copy. E-Mail Receipt Copy. Cancel. Receipt Copy/Filters - This will open a search bar with dates you can search for. Search for specific dates of a receipt. Show More Results.
description:
The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible.


To set Button Management for these buttons use the Right Menu POS Functions section.



 


The Account Deposit button will only show when a customer is selected in the Widgets menu. 
Cancel Sale disabling this option should be thoroughly considered as the clerk will not be able to lock the POS without this button.


Item Group

After selecting the Item Group button on the Right Menu PoS Functions you will see these buttons. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Group section. 


Cancel
Reset
Filter
OK


NOTE: Within the Right Menu POS Functions set of buttons several similar-looking buttons can be enabled or disabled independently of each other. For example, Item Shortcuts has a Cancel button that looks identical to the Cancel button in Item Group but is independently controlled in Button Management by enabling or disabling the option under Item Shortcuts.

Item Shortcuts

The Item Shortcuts option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Cancel button on Item Group but not on Item Shortcuts. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Shortcuts section. 

Create Gift Certificate

The Create Gift Certificate option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Create Gift Certificate. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Create Gift Certificate section. 

Sell Set

The Sell Set option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Sell Set. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Sell Set section. 

Make Expense 

The Make Expense option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Make Expense. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Make 

Expense section. 

Parked Transactions

The Parked Transactions option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Parked Transactions. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Parked Transactions section. Individual parked transactions listed have the following buttons that can be managed. 


Delete
Add to Basket


Find Receipt 

Within Find Receipt the buttons are named to match the titles given in Button Management. Some buttons use a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Find Receipt. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Find Receipt section. Individual receipts listed have the following buttons that can be managed. 


Reprint the Last Receipt.
Return.
Print Gift Copy.
E-Mail Receipt Copy.
Cancel.
 Receipt Copy/Filters - This will open a search bar with dates you can search for.
Search for specific dates of a receipt.
Show More Results.

title: Aside Menu
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible. TABLE OF CONTENTS X Report: Picklist Report: Cash Statement: Morning Amount: Card Terminal Actions: Journals: The Aside Menu can be accessed by clicking the "Show Aside Menu" button in the Header. Within the Aside Menu, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles given in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, navigate to the Aside Menu section. X Report: In the X Report section, the buttons are named to match the titles specified in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, go to the X Report section. Picklist Report: Within the Picklist Report section, the buttons are labeled according to the titles defined in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, access the Picklist Report section. Cash Statement: In the Cash Statement section, the buttons are named to align with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, refer to the Cash Statement section. Morning Amount: Within the Morning Amount section, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles given in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, access the Morning Amount section. Card Terminal Actions: In the Card Terminal Actions section, the buttons are named to match the titles specified in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, navigate to the Card Terminal Actions section. The Terminal Actions menu can be accessed from within the Card Terminal Actions menu. Journals: Within the Journals section, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles defined in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, refer to the Journals section.
description:
The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible.


TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • X Report:
  • Picklist Report:
  • Cash Statement:
  • Morning Amount:
  • Card Terminal Actions:
  • Journals:

The Aside Menu can be accessed by clicking the "Show Aside Menu" button in the Header. Within the Aside Menu, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles given in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, navigate to the Aside Menu section.


X Report:

In the X Report section, the buttons are named to match the titles specified in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, go to the X Report section.


Picklist Report:

Within the Picklist Report section, the buttons are labeled according to the titles defined in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, access the Picklist Report section.


Cash Statement:

In the Cash Statement section, the buttons are named to align with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, refer to the Cash Statement section.


Morning Amount:

Within the Morning Amount section, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles given in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, access the Morning Amount section.


Card Terminal Actions:

In the Card Terminal Actions section, the buttons are named to match the titles specified in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, navigate to the Card Terminal Actions section. The Terminal Actions menu can be accessed from within the Card Terminal Actions menu.


Journals:

Within the Journals section, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles defined in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, refer to the Journals section.

title: Payment
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible. Payment: In the Payment section, the buttons are named to match the titles provided in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, access the Payment section. However, please note that both the Quick Cash and Quick Card buttons have a similar appearance and appear in the Receipt section as well. Therefore, they need to be managed independently in both sections. Right Menu Payment: Within the Right Menu Payment section, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles specified in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, navigate to the Right Menu Payment section. Please note the following: - The Loyalty Bonus button will only appear if the Loyalty module is in use and a registered customer has accumulated enough points to redeem. - The Account button will only appear when a customer with a creditworthy account is selected.
description:
The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible.

Payment:

In the Payment section, the buttons are named to match the titles provided in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, access the Payment section. However, please note that both the Quick Cash and Quick Card buttons have a similar appearance and appear in the Receipt section as well. Therefore, they need to be managed independently in both sections.


Right Menu Payment:

Within the Right Menu Payment section, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles specified in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, navigate to the Right Menu Payment section. 


Please note the following:

- The Loyalty Bonus button will only appear if the Loyalty module is in use and a registered customer has accumulated enough points to redeem.

- The Account button will only appear when a customer with a creditworthy account is selected.

title: Terminal Actions
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible. The functions here are dependant on your card provider.
